website_summaries.verdict: A simple belay device that can be used with all sorts of ropes and for all different activities.
pros: Simple to use and makes belaying larger partners easy
A good price for anyone just getting into climbing who doesn't want to invest too much money
cons: Has a lot of tension for bigger ropes – 13.55 cm or more

customer_reviews.title: Keeps people from going splat.
customer_reviews.text: I'm fairly new to rock climbing, so this is the first belay device I have owned. It's sole purpose is to not let your partner fall and go splat. It completes this task quite handily. I have yet to splatter a partner while using this device, so it easily gets a 5 out of 5
customer_reviews.author: David R.

customer_reviews.title: Fits Small
customer_reviews.text: I'm 5'10" x 195lbs (lean). Usually wear M-L range clothes (32x32 levis jeans). The XL fits me perfect. Order big. Only used the harness once so far. Plan to put some miles on it and I like it a lot initially. Will update review if I find any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Russ

product_meta.title: PETZL - Verso, Ultralight Belay/Rappel Device
product_meta.description: VERSO belay/rappel device offers a lighter and more compact option for climbers looking to reduce the size and weight of their gear. V-shaped friction channels with asymmetrical side grooves adapt the rope friction for better control.
feature_bullets: ULTRALIGHT DESIGN: The Verso is Petzl's lightest belay/rappel device, weighing only 57 grams.
WORKS FOR ALL ROPES: Can be used with single (8.9 mm or greater diameter), half (8 mm or greater diameter), or twin (7.5 mm or greater diameter) rope.
GOES WHERE YOU DO: Ultra-compact design is easy to use and doesn't take up much space on your rack.
BRAKE POWER: Adapted braking for efficiency with larger diameter ropes.
TESTED TECHNOLOGY: Featuring ARC technology that adapts to the diameter of the rope used by increasing or decreasing the braking friction on the rope according to its diameter and condition.
